Welcome to the FanGraphs-exporter documentation!¶

FanGraphs-exporter is completely open-source.

See this project’s GitHub Repository.

API Reference¶

class WebDriver(self):

This is called by FanGraphs in __init__ to create the self.webdriver attribute. The attribute self.options holds the options returned when calling selenium.webdriver.firefox.options. The defaults in self.options are listed below:

  • self.options.headless: True

  • self.options.preferences:

    • "browser.download.folderList": 2

    • "browser.download.manager.showWhenStarting": False

    • "browser.download.dir": os.getcwd()

    • "browser.helperApps.neverAsk.saveToDisk": "text/csv"

class FanGraphs(self, *, setting)

Below are the compatible FanGraphs pages with the corresponding setting argument:

  • Major League Leaderboards: "leaders"

  • Projections: "projections"

Passing an invalid argument to setting will result in fgexporter.InvalidSettingError being raised.

get_options(self, category)¶
get_current(self, category)¶
config(self, **kwargs)¶

While multiple configurations can be passed, it is highly recommended that only one be passed at a time. Certain category configurations block the configurations of other categories.

e.g. When ‘leaders’ is passed to as the setting argument, configuring HOF to True prevents configuring Rookies to True at the same time.

For this reason, it is best practice to configure one category at a time, while using FanGraphs.get_current in between.

reset(self)¶
location(self)¶

Returns the current_url attribute of FanGraphs.browser. This is the equivalent of using FanGraphs.browser.current_url

end_task(self)¶

Calls the quit method of FanGraphs.browser. This is the equivalent of calling FanGraphs.browser.quit()

export(self)¶
